title: The most frustrating part of this game is that all the high burst champions ARE SO GOD DAMN SAFE
body:
{{champion:121}} - Four ways to get out of a misplay

{{champion:7}} Two low cooldown ways to get out of a misplay (minimum)

{{champion:157}} Many ways to get out of a misplay

{{champion:238}} Three ways to get out of a misplay.


There's so god damn much mobility in the game anymore that decisions literally don't matter anymore. It's FUCKING retarded and riot needs to do something about 

A. Mobility
B. Invisibility

FUCK these uncounterplayable bullshit things and give people that main immobile champions a way to deal with this garbage if you're not gonna fix their fucking burst.

replies.body:
Zed and LeBlanc: if they catch you at like 2000 units of distance away from you you're dead
Yasuo: If you have minions in your lane, you're dead no matter how far away you are
The trick is to run sideways into the jungle to get away from Yasuo.

> [{quoted}](name=Kadexe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VwUEuqA6,comment-id=00000003,timestamp=2018-12-10T17:51:04.861+0000)
>
> The trick is to run sideways into the jungle to get away from Yasuo.

Due to his build involving so many MS items he'll catch up either way anyway
Considering Yasuo's high base MS and usually a %MS item in his build, it doesn't matter.
and with minion changes chances are there will be minions in your lane constantly
{{champion:84}} : I pressed W and I'm out yaaaa yeeeeet
Meanwhile boards: tanks are not punished for misplays

Kha not meta 
Yas not meta 
Zed not meta
Leblanc meta
Riven has a lot of mobility and burst is she meta nope.
Urgot a slow champion with no busted is he meta yep
It almost like your wrong and do not want to learn how to play against something so you call it bs.
Not being meta doesn't mean they're not extremely unfun to play against.
Zeds meta again. Lethality meta is perfectly up his alley.
zed is not meta lol. faker himself has said that zed is bad to play llstylish plays zed but feels he should play another champ to climb because it's way harder to climb with zed.

But thats not the point. Fakers goals with league and and the general players goal with league are two very different goals. Fakers goal as a professional player is to be able to succeed. Nothing wrong with that, thats his job and he does it well. But my goal, (and most other players goal as well) is to have FUN. Because, y'know, its a _game_. Zed and other such champs are not _fun_ to play against. Get the idea?

top 3 mid picks... #2

leblanc is 4

neeko is 5

top 3 are irelia, zed and yasuo, at least by popularity

the master yasuo players have some insane win-rates on him as well
Yeah, and those winrates need insane amount of play time to achieve
LETHALITY META what season are you playing in since it is not this one.

> [{quoted}](name=boricCentaur1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VwUEuqA6,comment-id=000300020001,timestamp=2018-12-10T11:40:41.443+0000)
>
> LETHALITY META what season are you playing in since it is not this one.

Zed main detected.

In case you've been asleep this pre-season, Lethality is common again because the damage is so high armor is practically paper.

kha and yas have some of the highest pick rates in the game, though yas more for popularity but he is secretly pretty powerful

khazix for instance has 10% minimum pick rate in every division...

now, if we compare that to the EXTREMES, such as lucian, who is above 30% , jax, who is above 20% (though broken by runes...),  Akali in diamond+ (who has only an 8% pick rate because her ban rate is above 60% ....)

but 10% is still in the top 10 picks for the jungle role and the higher another champion is, the better that makes that statistic...

Ok and this has nothing to do with my point unless you're saying being popular in soloq means its meta since no that is not how it works champions are picked for 3 reasons 1 there meta, 2 people are easly snowball with them and carry, 3 people like playing them. Yas falls into popular and can carry and kha can very easily to snowball and carry.

> [{quoted}](name=boricCentaur1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VwUEuqA6,comment-id=000300040001,timestamp=2018-12-10T11:37:22.565+0000)
>
> Ok and this has nothing to do with my point unless you're saying being popular in soloq means its meta since no that is not how it works champions are picked for 3 reasons 1 there meta, 2 people are easly snowball with them and carry, 3 people like playing them. Yas falls into popular and can carry and kha can very easily to snowball and carry.

You don't understand what META means. It isn't a term to describe what pro players do it is just the most effective tactic available for whoever is currently playing that game. Every level of play has its own META; Yi and Garen are META champs in Bronze. If you are speaking about META in relation to the pro game you are only speaking about it in relation to those leagues not the rest of the player base. There is no such thing as an absolute META at any point in games like this because of the variance in ability both between levels of play and within them with various characters like {{champion:136}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:92}}  whose kits rely more on knowledge and repetition than others.
but yas has a 47% wr with an 11% pick rate? if that's correct shouldn't it be like that? he has a low wr and a high pick rate so he seems fine imo.

he actually has greater than a 20% pickrate in diamond+ worldwide 

https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/yasuo/diamond

which I think would justify it, but if we look at the best, we get some absurd numbers.  

someone has an 86% winrate on him in diamond 4, the highest master is 76.5

lucian has higher numbers and a larger number of master players as well

The champions people complain about have merit to the complaints

Assassins were meant to be able to get in AND out after picking off a target.
The problem is that they can now ignore the rest of the enemy team to get the priority targets.
The counter to that was always the support - enchanters had good CC and a strong enough shield.

Since people complained about supports being able to counter assassisn so easily (as the supports should), shields just got nerfed.
Same for Wardens.  Both of these sub-classes are important for stopping Divers and Assassins, and we shouldn’t just write them off as ‘anti-fun,’ unless we mean to repudiate their whole design.

Assassins are fun for the assassin players.
Supports are fun for everyone else.

Kha'Zix has 2 ways: his leap or his ult. If he used his leap to get to the target in the first place, then he would have had to kill them to get the reset. Seeing as your qualification is "misplay", then that reset is unlikely. That leaves his ult, which only stealths him for at most 2 seconds (only if he get's the evolve on his ult), and he still has to walk out.
If somehow he has his leap to get out of a misplay, then that means you just let him walk up to you, which is a misplay on your part for letting an assassin just walk up.

Yasuo's dash is unit targeted and only goes a fixed distance. If he's in the middle of your team after a misplay, he's not getting out. If somehow you are just letting him walk out, then again, that's your problem.

Zed has only 2 ways to get out: his W or R recasts. Seeing as he likely uses his W to get in range or to get extra damage on Death Mark, that means both his W and R recasts are relatively close by or unable to be used again.

Unless you are just letting him walk into your team, which again is your fault for letting an assassin just walk up to you.

> [{quoted}](name=AvantelWings,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VwUEuqA6,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-12-10T03:33:39.711+0000)
>
> Kha'Zix has 2 ways: his leap or his ult. If he used his leap to get to the target in the first place, then he would have had to kill them to get the reset. Seeing as your qualification is "misplay", then that reset is unlikely. That leaves his ult, which only stealths him for at most 2 seconds (only if he get's the evolve on his ult), and he still has to walk out.
> If somehow he has his leap to get out of a misplay, then that means you just let him walk up to you, which is a misplay on your part for letting an assassin just walk up.
> 
> Yasuo's dash is unit targeted and only goes a fixed distance. If he's in the middle of your team after a misplay, he's not getting out. If somehow you are just letting him walk out, then again, that's your problem.
> 
> Zed has only 2 ways to get out: his W or R recasts. Seeing as he likely uses his W to get in range or to get extra damage on Death Mark, that means both his W and R recasts are relatively close by or unable to be used again.
> 
> Unless you are just letting him walk into your team, which again is your fault for letting an assassin just walk up to you.

That means the only way to kill them is to wait for them to jump in and use their dashes, and then kill them. If they overextend while pushing/cleaning waves theres no way to catch them out by themsleves before a fight, because they ill just dash away.

That leaves no agency for a player in game. Having to wait for the enemy to fk up to kill them isn't the best game design.

Thats a bad argument. This isn't call of duty. Killing the enemy isn't necessarily required to win the game.

And worse is the idea that assassins or mobile champions are immune to picks just because they have mobility. They aren't immune to someone or people camping a bush or hidden area before being bursted and/or chain cced. 

Or the idea that because someone who isn't a mobile fighter or assassin can't match their split either because they aren't one of those 2.

Waiting for your opponent to make mistakes is how every single diamond+ player wins games. I've heard everyone from Tyler to Faker to LS and Casters say the same thing. 
If nobody ever made a mistake,winning from behind would be literally impossible but it's not. 

Focus on making fewer mistakes and learn to punish your opponent when they do and you'll climb. The hard part is learning how of course ... which is where I get stuck

I think they meant that he can reactivate his ult twice if it is evolved

if not, you could also count that his W can reset off of kills and his ult allows more than 1 stealth usage

so, they're counting total uses of abilities

> [{quoted}](name=AvantelWings,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VwUEuqA6,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-12-10T03:33:39.711+0000)

Seeing as your qualification is "misplay", then that reset is unlikely. That leaves his ult, which only stealths him for at most 2 seconds (only if he get's the evolve on his ult), and he still has to walk out.
> If somehow he has his leap to get out of a misplay, then that means you just let him walk up to you, which is a misplay on your part for letting an assassin just walk up.

I Strongly aggree with this comment. mod or not. at least someone can put it into words and NOT get 90+ downvotes.
The most frustrating part of this game is people don't know how to play around most champs.

akali:  over 60% banrate in diamond+

yasuo:  around 25% banrate in diamond+ and 20% pick rate

vayne:  the champion they are going to make permabanned once players figure out how to NOT BUILD HER CRITICAL, has around 44% winrate in diamond+, but, her best players all achieve greater than 60% winrate.  Even in master, her highest winrate "best player" is 65%

although it's a lower division, one of the best Dr Mundo players in the world has a 92% winrate in platinum...  and one of the best in master has 67%

if we want to go by popularity in diamond+ as the real meta;

Lucian holds the marksman role

lee sin holds the jungler role

thresh holds the support role

Yasuo holds the mid role, followed closely by Irelia, who exceeds him in popularity because she can choose another position without getting wasted in top lane, yet even then, his pick rate is almost identical to hers

Jax holds the top role

#All of these are commonly complained about and are the top picks for the BEST PLAYERS IN THE WORLD

I dont understand your arguement.

The mentioned champions have clear ways to outplay.

As well if you really wanna get into it here is the 4 champs for each role with the highest winrates plat +

Mid - zil mord cass malz 
Bottom - mord twitch kog ziggs
Top - wukong cass kayle mord
Support - sion sona kennen zyra
Jungle - udyr jax shaco ramnus 

Such a mobile roster right ? 

But lets complain about akali who has a 42.7 winrate

> [{quoted}](name=mack9112,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VwUEuqA6,comment-id=000a00000000,timestamp=2018-12-10T11:33:33.745+0000)
>
> I dont understand your arguement.
> 
> The mentioned champions have clear ways to outplay.
>

> Mid - zil mord cass malz 
> Bottom - mord twitch kog ziggs
> Top - wukong cass kayle mord
> Support - sion sona kennen zyra
> Jungle - udyr jax shaco ramnus 
> 
> Such a mobile roster right ? 
> 
> But lets complain about akali who has a 42.7 winrate

Akali's win rate may be low but she's turbo cancer to play against.

She's the definition of no counter play with her current W.

> [{quoted}](name=Antenora,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VwUEuqA6,comment-id=000a000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-10T11:45:38.235+0000)
>
> Akali's win rate may be low but she's turbo cancer to play against.
> 
> She's the definition of no counter play with her current W.

Akali is also a basically perma banned champ. Can't really have a win rate when you're perma banned.

Go to lolalytics, go to Diamond +, click on order by ban rate. Akali is the highest banned champ even with 45% winrate. You are claiming that his is because these "people don't know how to around most champs." These are the people that should know how to play around them and still ban her.

We complain until Riot realises what to do, to reduce her banrate from above 50% to 5% with 50% winrate. Not only so we can enjoy the game as no one likes playing against many of these champs but so those who like playing her can actually play her.

I mean Kog'Maw is played by 1.2 % of people and banned 0.1% of the time, compare that to Lucian who is 33% ban, 35% pick and 52% win. He should be at win of 47% win with that play and ban rate.

So a champion is bad because alot of people enjoy playing them ?

If a champion has fun mechanics people will play them.

Bad? What? I never mentioned such a thing, if anything Akali is too good.

Her shroud makes a mockery of the game, stable mechanics like true site and a turret killing you was thrown out the window in exchange for 'fun'. And yet, there she is with a 73% ban rate in Master. I guess master players "don't know how to play around most champs" though.

where are you getting your information from?

https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/overview/na/middle/by-winrate

of course, winrate means very little if your pick rate is abyssmal.  For the champions y ou've chosen, zilean is seen in less than 1 in 100 matches

mordekaiser is not even used mid?

Cassiopeia is actually meta with greater than 3% pick rate and greater than 50% winrate , if you go by "average pick rate and greater than 50% win rate" set for meta, but there are lots of ways to define what is meta including simply popularity

malzahar also meta and doing well by the above rules

The thing is though, the top pick rates tend to be what is the most efficient tactic to use and when pick rates skyrocket, winrate drops.  It's when it doesn't that it's a HUGE PROBLEM, but we're also seeing a HUGE INCREASE IN POPULARITY for the meta champions

30% pick rate is absurd for lucian...that's literally 1 in 3 games he appears if he's not banned and he has a 25% banrate in the platinum division

The average pick rate for meta champions is supposed to be between 8 and 20% with 20% being an extreme compared to the typical powerful meta of 15% at most

let's compare:  lucian has a pick rate of 30%  , the high level of pick rate is 15%, the extreme is 20%,  by those numbers,  Lucian is 3x as extreme as a normal extreme

if we look at what is healthy meta, we get Ashe:  53% winrate and almost 6% pick rate ;  miss fortune at 8% pick rate and exactly 50% win rate ; among other champions with decent pick rate and win rate but not numbers that crowd out other picks

Do you ever think particular champions are played alot because they have mechanics people enjoy ? 

Alot of people really enjoy Lucian 

Alot of people really enjoy yasuo 

The most played champions will always be the most banned thats simple logic

The argument here is that immobile champs have no chance in this game but the numbers clearly show otherwise. 

Mobility champions have plenty of outplay potential and I'm tired of coming on this board to listen to people who simply play refusing to learn how to play against champs .

My second most played champion is velkoz mid and I have faced every champion these boards proclaim as unstoppable. Learn to outplay them understand your champs strengths and there champs weaknesses .

An example being against a zed as velkoz you can literally poke him from a screen away in distance and never give him an opportunity to all in you but assassin's are just the worst apparently.

I don't get why Mobility in general doesn't get nerfed.

It's distance, the cooldown of the ability, literally just nerf something.
{{champion:121}} has 4? What?

Id argue Yasuo is the least safe out of all of them, his dashes are conditional. The other three can just fuck off over a wall if their in trouble nor do they need shit to dash to. 

(Although this may be bais as I suck living ass at Yasuo)
Waittttttt waitttt waiiitttttt you’re complaining about zed he’s literal dog shit rn
Because Zed bad delete Yasuo it's the common circlejerk here.
the only decent thing about boards is the art/meme/lore portions. Their gameplay is so biased it hurts.

The worst thing is that I end up defending assasins here as an adc main, and I'm not gonna lie, I absotely hate playing against them but I just acept that it's part of the game and I dont want them to be removed like some ppl here unironically wish.
What are the 4 ways for {{champion:121}} to get out?

> {{champion:238}} Three ways to get out of a misplay.

1. Unless Zed has his W shadow out and didn't use it's teleport yet, you should always be able to cc him when he ults you, thanks to the delay on his ult shadow.

2. His W shadow has an 20 second cooldown and is his only way to harass laners, what are you doing during the 20 seconds where zed can't punish you?

3. Let me guess, flash is his third way to get out of an misplay?
ah boards... i wish i was an adc/mage main it will be so funny to stay in here
